remarks: The union of a set of positive reals (if a positive real) is its supremum (the least upper bound).  Part of Proposition 9-3.3 of [Gleason] p. 122.  (Contributed by NM, 19-May-1996.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 12-Jun-2013.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
